title: Bug 3666: Code Completion Hungry code assist
OB:
The code assist currently produces: 

 baz(x.foo()) 

 This is incorrect because it is missing the second 'foo()' method call in the 'baz' parameter.
EB:
The code is changed to: 

 baz(x.foo().foo()) 

 This correction ensures that the code is valid and will compile successfully.
SR:
1. Open the UI and enable the code assist feature.
2. Edit the 'bar' method in the enclosed class by adding another parameter to the 'baz' call.
3. Observe that the code assist adds the parameter in the wrong place, causing a compilation error.
